messages.content: Text created/updated with CEFR level B1

Text saved: I used to work a normal five-day week. But after I had time off for my new baby, I decided I wanted to spend more time with my children before they start school. I talked with my boss, and we agreed to reduce my schedule to a three-day work week. Of course, this also meant a big cut in my pay, because I am paid for the number of days I work. However, I have noticed that my amount of work has not changed at all. I am now doing five days of work in only three days, but I am getting paid much less for it

metadata.feedback_text: FAIL. The text violates the B1 standard for sentence length. Sentences are too long and complex. For example, 'But after I had time off for my new baby, I decided I wanted to spend more time with my children before they start school' is 27 words. This must be broken into shorter sentences. The sentences 'Of course, this also meant a big cut in my pay...' (22 words) and 'I am now doing five days of work...' (21 words) are also too long. Sentences must not exceed approximately 15 words.

messages.content: Text created/updated with CEFR level B1

Text saved: I used to work a normal five-day week. After my new baby, I took some time off work. I wanted to spend more time with my children before they started school. I talked with my boss, and we agreed to a three-day work week. Of course, this also meant a big cut in my pay. This is because I am paid for the number of days I work. However, I have noticed my amount of work has not changed at all. I now do five days of work in only three days. But I am getting paid much less for it.

metadata.feedback_text: PASS. The text is a perfect example of B1 writing. Sentences are short and clear. Vocabulary is simple and appropriate. Complex ideas like 'parental leave' and 'pro-rata' were correctly simplified without losing meaning. The text is factually accurate.
